result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyrique C Holley Davis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carrying A Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Sign up for probation no later than 9/23/22.

miscConds.notes:
No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Cooperate with the agent all conditions of probation.

Submit a DNA sample by 9/23/22 and pay the surcharge during probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
Pay all costs, fees and surcharges during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
Court ordered case expunged upon successful completion of probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyrique C Holley Davis

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tyrique C Holley Davis in court.  Attorney john k riley in court for Tyrique C Holley Davis.  
Attorney Olivia Simmons in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  
*
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    6efendant ordered to serve 30 DAYS in the House of Correction, credit of 1 day time served.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 6 months with the following conditions:

- Sign up for probation no later than 9/23/22.
- Complete 20 hours of community service.
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- No prescription drugs without a valid prescription
- Obtain/maintain full time school/work.
- Cooperate with the agent all conditions of probation.
- Submit a DNA sample by 9/23/22 and pay the surcharge during probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept

- Pay ALL costs, fees and surcharges during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
- Defendant advised of his right to appeal. 

COURT ORDERED CASE EXPUNGED UPON SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION OF PROBATION

Defendant Tyrique C Holley Davis in court with attorney john k riley.  
Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Hearing held via Zoom.  Status conference held.  Atty. Riley requests a plea and sentencing date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Tyrique C Holley Davis in court with attorney john k riley.  
Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Hearing held via Zoom.  Atty. Riley has received discovery and an offer and would like time to review it.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Status conference scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Tyrique C Holley Davis in court with attorney john k riley.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 01.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 01.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Receipt Number: 22RP019292,
Amount: $20.00
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/11/2022@1:00pm
